VII.i.2.A.3.b
.
VA’s Obligation to Assist Claimants in Obtaining Documentary Evidence of a Marriage
If a claimant is unable to provide documentary evidence of a life event, such as a marriage, VA has an obligation to assist in obtaining such evidence by sending a request to the appropriate records custodian.
Important
:  The policy expressed in the preceding paragraph applies even if the claimant submitted a
September 2018 or later
version of
VA Form 21-686c
.
Reference
:  For more information on requesting documentary evidence of a life event from custodians of public records, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 2.A.1.e
.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section A - Establishing the Validity of a Marriage for Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Purposes
